content: Hi folks. I'm looking to get a PR merged in the "net2" crate, which is in the rust-lang-nursery organisation right now. I asked Alex Crichton, but he says he is not maintaining it anymore. Is it possible for Patrick Mooney (pfmooney on GH) and myself (jclulow on GH) to take over maintenance of this crate? We would be happy to set up a new GitHub organisation and get CI/CD builds going, etc.
If this is the wrong place to ask, I apologise. I was directed here by huyuumi in the Discord.

I don't think this working group is the right place to ask. If you're looking to take over maintenance of a crate that's currently in rust-lang-nursery, I think it'd make sense to coordinate that with some combination of the crate maintainer or the libs team?

OK, thanks. I'm really looking for a central place to address issues around crates in the nursery org in general, as the actual ownership seems somewhat distributed amongst the ~49 people in that org but I can't really see a central place to reach whoever is in charge. Do you know of one?
FWIW, this is part of the reason we're trying to deprecate rust-lang-nursery, because it has this kind of "semi-official" status.
Insofar as the maintainers are Rust folks but it's not clear whether the projects themselves are "owned" by the Rust project and can be given to a new maintainer.
Let me see if I can find someone specific to refer you to; one moment.
Thank you so much! Definitely understand the issues and the need for transition.

I should note that I'm extremely grateful to Alex for his help so far with getting illumos support into Rust, and I'm just trying to avoid bothering him too often. If he's the right one to talk to about it, though, I can definitely pursue it with him!
I already replied on discord, after they were sent here. :sweat_smile:
Thank you both! I've spoken with Alex and have been directed to the libs or infra teams.
